findings.details: Post content already wraps long strings and tables scroll on small screens. Pages can still benefit from rendering optimizations on long-form content.
Manual scan of templates/pages showed no obvious placeholder links. External URLs in posts require periodic validation.
Layouts include SEO tags, keywords fallback, and structured data. Page/front matter descriptions present.
Long-form pages can render more efficiently; reduced motion support could be stronger for accessibility.

recommendations: Optimize long-form page rendering with content-visibility
Provide reduced-motion overrides for transitions and animations
